feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel Sensitive Data Exposure
entry.content:
Laravel before 5.5.10 mishandles the remember_me token verification process because DatabaseUserProvider does not have constant-time token comparison.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14775
  • https://github.com/laravel/framework/pull/21320
  • https://github.com/laravel/framework/releases/tag/v5.5.10
  • https://laravel-news.com/laravel-v5-5-11
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c2v7-j5gq-wcq4

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
SilverStripe CMS before 3.6.1 has XSS via an SVG document that is mishandled by (1) the Insert Media option in the content editor or (2) an admin/assets/add pathname, as demonstrated by the admin/pages/edit/EditorToolbar/MediaForm/field/AssetUploadField/upload URI, aka issue SS-2017-017.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14498
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/25b77a2ff8deabe8e8894002b9a5647eaec27b0a
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-installer/commit/c25478bef75cc5482852e80a1fa6f1f0e6460e39
  • https://docs.silverstripe.org/en/3/changelogs/3.6.1
  • http://lists.openwall.net/full-disclosure/2017/09/14/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j696-6m57-mcrv

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure
entry.content:
In Moodle 3.x, various course reports allow teachers to view details about users in the groups they can't access.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12157
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=358586
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/85b531e8beae3497ec2075e07e59c581fccb317c
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124103841/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100848
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gw95-48xq-gqf9

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Moodle 3.x has XSS in the contact form on the "non-respondents" page in non-anonymous feedback.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12156
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=358585
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a39d2976fe5e91da7a28a8512d5b94d4a27067b8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124104026/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/100867
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7mfw-g8x4-rq2w

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 6.0.0 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the Title parameter to htdocs/admin/menus/edit.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14241
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/d26b2a694de30f95e46ea54ea72cc54f0d38e548
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h3vg-4x76-v28w

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM Sensitive Data Disclosure
entry.content:
There is a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability in document.php in Dolibarr ERP/CRM version 6.0.0 via the file parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-14240
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/d26b2a694de30f95e46ea54ea72cc54f0d38e548
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p9wf-x8h5-44fr

entry.title: [genix/cms] GeniXCMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
GeniXCMS 1.1.5 has XSS via the from, id, lang, menuid, mod, q, status, term, to, or token parameter. NOTE: this might overlap CVE-2017-14761, CVE-2017-14762, or CVE-2017-14765.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-17431
  • https://code610.blogspot.com/2017/12/modus-operandi-genixcms-115.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pwr7-j6g3-hmx6

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS User Enumeration
entry.content:
Response discrepancy in the login and password reset forms in SilverStripe CMS before 3.5.5 and 3.6.x before 3.6.1 allows remote attackers to enumerate users via timing attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-12849
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-005
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fwhr-g5r4-xgxf

entry.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS User Enumeration
entry.content:
Response discrepancy in the login and password reset forms in SilverStripe CMS before 3.5.5 and 3.6.x before 3.6.1 allows remote attackers to enumerate users via timing attacks.

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fwhr-g5r4-xgxf

entry.title: [october/october] Stored Cross-Site Scripting October CMS
entry.content:
An svg file upload vulnerability in October CMS v3.4.4 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of a browser via a crafted svg file. Attackers must be authenticated as users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37692
  • https://okankurtulus.com.tr/2023/07/24/october-cms-v3-4-4-stored-cross-site-scripting-xss-authenticated/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r47v-rxcg-p28j

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo XSS
entry.content:
Croogo version 2.3.1-17-g6f82e6c contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Page name that can result in execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000510
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/847
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r4h9-gv2m-9x97

entry.title: [austintoddj/canvas] Canvs Canvas XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Canvs Canvas version 3.4.2 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in User's details that can result in denial of service and execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000507
  • https://github.com/cnvs/canvas/issues/359
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-94hc-7qc9-34rf

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr version 6.0.2 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Product details that can result in execution of javascript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000509
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/issues/7727
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hqfh-p9h7-m6v5

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Dolibarr ERP/CRM is affected by stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in versions through 7.0.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18259
  • https://www.wizlynxgroup.com/security-research-advisories/vuln/WLX-2017-008
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4323-cfj5-98mh

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM contain XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
The test_sql_and_script_inject function in htdocs/main.inc.php in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 6.0.4 blocks some event attributes but neither onclick nor onscroll, which allows XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-17971
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/issues/8000
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qjq9-wx5j-jrg6

entry.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
phpMyAdmin versions 4.7.x (prior to 4.7.6.1/4.7.7) are vulnerable to a CSRF weakness. By deceiving a user to click on a crafted URL, it is possible to perform harmful database operations such as deleting records, dropping/truncating tables etc.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000499
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45284/
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-9/
  • http://cyberworldmirror.com/vulnerability-phpmyadmin-lets-attacker-perform-drop-table-single-click/
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201208204518/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040163
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f9hx-5jq4-fgjm
